newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Erste says no Creditanstalt bid today.
newsitem.headline: Erste says no Creditanstalt bid today.

text.p: Savings bank Die Erste said it would not submit a final offer for government sell-off candidate Creditanstalt today, the deadline imposed by the government.
"It will take us more than just a few days," a spokesman for Die Erste told Reuters. "We are not in the last lap (of the negotiations) yet," he said.

Die Erste is currently in negotiations with its consortium partners over its original suggestion to set up a joint holding company with Creditanstalt, in which the government holds a 70 percent voting stake. The group is the only bidder left in the race for the country's number two bank.
Finance Minister Viktor Klima last month said he expected a final offer for the bank's privatisation to land on his desk by the end of August.
Nobody in the finance ministry was available for comment but a source close to the ministry indicated it was likely the government would extend its deadline.
"Maybe they're about to come out with something. Maybe a miracle will happen," the source told Reuters. -- Knut Engelmann, Vienna newsroom +431 53112 274
